oai_dc:dc.dc:title: U.S. Weather Bureau Airport Station, Nashville, Tennessee, 1961 October 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Staff operating the weather instruments at the U. S. Weather Bureau Airport Station, Nashville, Tennessee, October 1st, 1961. The Signal Service office for Nashville opened circa 1870, remaining downtown when the Weather Bureau took over. A separate facility at Berry Airport (currently Nashville International Airport) was opened in June 1937, and the two facilities were consolidated there in on 12/18/1950. A WSR-3 radar was installed in 1957. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
